summary: This bill, the Government Office Realignment And Closure Act of 2025 (GORAC Act), mandates the Comptroller General to evaluate federal agencies and programs for duplication, waste, or obsolescence. It requires the use of a non-Federal auditor to conduct evaluations and recommend realignments, consolidations, or eliminations. The Comptroller General must submit recommendations and proposed legislation to Congress. The legislation proposed by the Comptroller General includes provisions to address the implementation of the reforms. The bill outlines specific procedures for congressional consideration, including expedited processes and limitations on amendments. It also provides for employee relocation and directs savings to pay down the national debt.
